title: A Quarter Century of Change At the Workplace
abstractText:
This project examines the key changes in British employment relations between 1980 and 2004 using, inter alia, the five Workplace Industrial/Employment Relations Surveys (WERS). These contain many questions that span the whole period, panel surveys that link each of the cross-sections and, for the two most recent surveys, data collected from samples of workers at each workplace. A particularly interesting feature is the timing of the last two surveys, which allows a direct comparison of the impact of the Thatcher/Major Conservative administrations of the period 1979 to 1997 and the Blair Labour administration from 1997 to 2004.

Each of the chapters will be co-authored by one of the projectâ€™s investigators and an expert in the subject-area concerned. Dissemination will be via a monograph published by a leading international publisher, and an accompanying conference.
